page.description: Enables wrapping custom HTML around the ViewBox control's Layout.

discussion.p: The ViewBox layout can be wrapped in a template containing sticky (i.e. non-scrolling) content. For example, a wrapper can be used to add a sticky header to the top of the ViewBox. As the ViewBox content is scrolled, the header remains fixed in place.
This property exposes the [Wrapper HTML] and [Wrapper initialization javascript] properties when enabled.

figure.title: ViewBox Properties Tab with Use wrapper and Wrapper HTML properties highlighted
figure.alt: ViewBox Properties Tab with Use wrapper and Wrapper HTML properties highlighted

description.p: To define a *[ui:ViewBox wrapper]*, check the *[ui:Use wrapper]* property. Then, define the HTML content in the [Wrapper HTML] property.

The Wrapper HTML must include a div element with an attribute called *[html:a5-layout-target]* and the value of this attribute must be set to *[html:true]*. This is the div where the ViewBox layout will be injected
